Token.Abstract: This is the core object used to represent the swiper. This object becomes a base class for specific swiper objects designed for the given peripheral
This is used internally to note the type of encryption used on the SRED data
This is used internally to note the type of encryption used on the SRED data
This is used internally to note the type of encryption used on the SRED data
The delegate responsible for handling events from the card terminal
The delegate responsible for handling events from the card terminal
The delegate responsible for handling events from the card terminal
The current connection status of the device
The current connection status of the device
The current connection status of the device
Query to see if bluetooth is supported by the current swiper class
Query to see if bluetooth is supported by the current swiper class
Query to see if bluetooth is supported by the current swiper class
Query to see if audiojack is supported by the current swiper class. Note that you must specify the correct input type for the hardware being used at the time of connection
Query to see if audiojack is supported by the current swiper class. Note that you must specify the correct input type for the hardware being used at the time of connection
Query to see if audiojack is supported by the current swiper class. Note that you must specify the correct input type for the hardware being used at the time of connection
Indication of whether or not the card terminal supports NFC
Indication of whether or not the card terminal supports NFC
Indication of whether or not the card terminal supports NFC
Indication of whether or not the card terminal allows manual card entry on the terminal
Indication of whether or not the card terminal allows manual card entry on the terminal
Indication of whether or not the card terminal allows manual card entry on the terminal
The current hardware interface used by the connected device, if any
The current hardware interface used by the connected device, if any

Creates an instance of a swiper, with a delegate assigned at instantiation

Parameter.Name: delegate
Parameter.Abstract: The initial delegate that the swiper will call with events. This can be changed at any time after instantiation.

Token.Abstract: Unavailable default initializer
This will connect the current Swiper object to whatever hardware interface is selected at the time of the call

Parameter.Name: inputType
Parameter.Abstract: The type of hardware interface used to communicate with the device - Audio or Bluetooth

Token.Abstract: Disconnects the current hardware and closes communication between the mobile device and the card terminal
x Check continuously for card events - dips or swipes. Does not return NFC tap events
Stop checking continuously for card events
Cancels the current transaction

Parameter.Name: customMessage
Parameter.Abstract: This will be displayed instead of default prompt (but message will be lost if request is pending)

Token.Abstract: Stat a transaction by requesting that the merchant manually enter the card data into the terminal. This will only handle manual card events. Any attempt to swipe, tap, or insert a card will do nothing.

Parameter.Name: request
Parameter.Abstract: A pointer to the request object used to complete the payment request. This must be populated with all required info as the transaction will begin immediately if the card entry is successful. If the card entry is canceled then a fail message will be sent to the delegate

Token.Abstract: Start a contact EMV transaction. If no EMV card is inserted, the swiper will request that a card be inserted or swiped. This handles swipe events.

Parameter.Name: request
Parameter.Abstract: A pointer to the request object used to complete the EMV Request. This must be populated with all required info as any request for online processing will happen automatically if the terminal requests it.

Parameter.Name: transactionType
Parameter.Abstract: The transaction type to set in the Application Cryptogram - Such as a goods sale, refund, or cashback transaction. Some devices handle cashback on the terminal and will process cashback transactions as sale and will then allow the terminal user to set a cashback amount. AnywhereCommerce devices must have the cashback amount / type set at the start of the transaction. Miura devices will enable cashback only if this is set to type Cashback but will process as a sale if the user declines to enter a cashback amount

Token.Abstract: Start a contactless EMV or MSD transaction. Some hardware allows card swipes in NFC mode, others do not. Does nothing if NFC is not supported on the current terminal hardware - be sure to check if NFC is available

Parameter.Name: request
Parameter.Abstract: A pointer to the request object used to complete the EMV Request. This must be populated with all required info as any request for online processing will happen automatically if the terminal requests it.

Parameter.Name: transactionType
Parameter.Abstract: The transaction type to set in the Application Cryptogram - Such as a goods sale, refund, or cashback transaction. Some devices handle cashback on the terminal and will process cashback transactions as sale and will then allow the terminal user to set a cashback amount. AnywhereCommerce devices must have the cashback amount / type set at the start of the transaction

Token.Abstract: Generate Payment Method using card information captured from the card terminal

Parameter.Name: request
Parameter.Abstract: A request object that will be populated with the information captured by the terminal

Token.Abstract: If the terminal is configured to pass application selection onto the application layer, this function must be called to select the card application, when requested.
If the terminal is configured to pass final transaction confirmation requests onto the application layer, this function must be called to confirm the transaction total prior to online authorization

Parameter.Name: confirmed
Parameter.Abstract: A boolean indicating whether the card holder has accepted the final total

Token.Abstract: This function will indicate whether or not the application developer can request to have custom text displayed onto the terminal screen

ReturnValue.Abstract: A boolean indicating whether or not the swiper's display can show custom text

Token.Abstract: This function will clear the display on terminals that allow you to display custom text

If supported by the terminal hardware, this will request that the custom text be displayed on the screen. The text should be line formatted by the developer based on the character width of the display in question.

Parameter.Name: text
Parameter.Abstract: A string of text that will be displayed on the terminal

Token.Abstract: If an Application can be run as credit or debit, and the terminal hardware does not support account type selection, then the UI application will be asked to select credit or debit. If the developer does not implement the appropriate delegate function, then the default of CREDIT will be selected

Parameter.Name: type
Parameter.Abstract: The account type that the user has selected. This must be 'credit' OR 'debit', any other input will default to credit.

Token.Abstract: This function will return the serial number of the credit card terminal.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A credit card terminal serial number

Token.Abstract: This function will return the software version number of the credit card terminal.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The software version of the terminal's OS

Token.Abstract: This function returns an account type of 'Credit' 'Debit' or 'CreditOrDebit' based on the application selected

Parameter.Name: aid
Parameter.Abstract: The AID that has been selected by the card holder / terminal

ReturnValue.Abstract: An enumeration indacting what type of transactions can be run against that AID.

Token.Abstract: This method is called to determine card insertion status for prompt messages, must override
This method is called to determine default device prompt text

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: An optional array of strings to be used in prompt construction

Token.Abstract: This function should be called automatically to take a response from the processor and generate a TLV string that can be sent to the terminal after an online processing request has been completed. It is is only used internally.

Parameter.Name: response
Parameter.Abstract: The response from the processor, including any EMV data returned by the issuing bank

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: Any server errors that may have been returned during the processing request - this determines whether a request was declined on or offline

ReturnValue.Abstract: A TLV string containing the appropriate data to be sent to the terminal after online processing.
